name: market for burnt shale | burnt shale | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10418/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'burnt shale', in the Global geography.;In this market, expert judgement was used to develop product specific transport distance estimations.;burnt shale' is a fossil fuel. It is used as a solid fuel and is sourced from burning oil shale. Its main applications are in the following sectors: raw material in chemical and construction-materials processing and power production.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'burnt shale',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'burnt shale',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.
